title: Mummy (GruntHack)

| A zombie:* [does not breathe](/wiki/Breathless "Breathless").
* is [mindless](/wiki/Mindless "Mindless").
* has [a head, a couple of arms, and a torso](/wiki/Humanoid "Humanoid").
* is [poisonous](/wiki/Poisonous "Poisonous") to eat.
* [does not eat](/wiki/Inediate "Inediate"). (\*)
* is [undead](/wiki/Undead "Undead").
* is normally generated [hostile](/wiki/Hostile "Hostile").
* has [infravision](/wiki/Infravision "Infravision"). |                     |

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), **[mummies](/wiki/Mummies "Mummies")** are a type of monster that [can be generated as any monster race](/wiki/Racial_monster "Racial monster").

## Generation

Randomly generated mummies are always hostile.

A mummy will leave an aged [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse") of whatever racial monster they were upon death.

## Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was  
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials  
employed in the process, and the words of power which were  
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have  
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited  
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de  
l'Embaumement. ...  
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now  
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of  
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,  
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple  
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready  
for the tomb.

\[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]

- *This page is a **[stub](/wiki/Category:Stubs "Category:Stubs")**. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by [**expanding this page**.](https://nethackwiki.com/index.php?title=Mummy_\(GruntHack\)\&action=edit)*

html:
Mummy (GruntHack)

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
M zombie
Attacks Claw 2d4, claw 2d4
M zombie
Attacks

Claw 2d4, claw 2d4

Base level 6

Speed 12
Base AC 4
Base MR 30
Alignment -5 (chaotic)
Frequency (by normal means) 3 (Rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 1450
Nutritional value 200
Size Medium
Resistances Cold, sleep, poison
Resistances conveyed None

A zombie:

  • does not breathe.
  • is mindless.
  • has a head, a couple of arms, and a torso.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • does not eat. (*)
  • is undead.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • has infravision.

In GruntHack, mummies are a type of monster that can be generated as any monster race.

Generation

Randomly generated mummies are always hostile.

A mummy will leave an aged corpse of whatever racial monster they were upon death.

Encyclopedia entry

But for an account of the manner in which the body was
bandaged, and a list of the unguents and other materials
employed in the process, and the words of power which were
spoken as each bandage was laid in its place, we must have
recourse to a very interesting papyrus which has been edited
and translated by M. Maspero under the title of Le Rituel de
l'Embaumement. ...
Everything that could be done to preserve the body was now
done, and every member of it was, by means of the words of
power which changed perishable substances into imperishable,
protected to all eternity; when the final covering of purple
or white linen had been fastened upon it, the body was ready
for the tomb.

[ Egyptian Magic, by E.A. Wallis Budge ]
This page is a stub. Should you wish to do so, you can contribute by expanding this page.

In [[GruntHack]], '''[[mummies]]''' are a type of monster that [[Racial monster|can be generated as any monster race]].

==Generation==
Randomly generated mummies are always hostile.

A mummy will leave an aged [[corpse]] of whatever racial monster they were upon death.
